title: Qian Qichen_Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China

quotes: Qian Qichen (1928.1.5-), Vice Premier (1993.3-), Minister of Foreign Affairs (1988.4 â1998.3), People's Republic of China
Qian Qichen joined the Communist Party of China in 1942
From 1945 to 1949, he was staff of Dagong Bao (L'impartial)
From 1949 to 1953, he was member of the Party Committees and Secretary of the Communist Youth League Committees of the Xuhui, Changning, and Yangpu Districts of Shanghai
From 1953 to 1954, he did research work in the General Office of Central Committee of the Communist Youth League
In 1954, he went to Central Communist Youth League School in the Soviet Union to pursue studies
Counsellor in the Chinese Embassy in the Soviet Union (1972.4 â 1974.4)
Ambassador to Guinea (1974.8 â 1976.11)
Ambassador to Guinea-Bissau concurrently (1974.9 â 1975.10)
Director General of Information Department of Ministry of Foreign Affairs (1976.11 â 1982.4)
Vice Foreign Minister (1982.4 â 1988.4)
Foreign Minister (1988.4 â 1998.3)
State Councilor and Foreign Minister concurrently (1991.4 â 1993.3)
Qian Qichen (1928.1.5-), Vice Premier (1993.3-), Minister of Foreign Affairs (1988.4 â1998.3), People's Republic of China

Born in Jiading, Shanghai, Qian Qichen joined the Communist Party of China in 1942
From 1949 to 1953, he was member of the Party Committees and Secretary of the Communist Youth League Committees of the Xuhui, Changning, and Yangpu Districts of Shanghai
In 1954, he went to Central Communist Youth League School in the Soviet Union to pursue studies
successively served as Second Secretary in the Chinese Embassy in the Soviet Union
Counsellor in the Chinese Embassy in the Soviet Union (1972.4 â 1974.4)
Ambassador to Guinea (1974.8 â 1976.11)
Ambassador to Guinea-Bissau concurrently (1974.9 â 1975.10)
